statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UMBC 86, Lafayette 51
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Jay Greene had 18 points and eight assists, Chris Pugh added 17 points and nine rebounds, and Maryland-Baltimore County routed Lafayette 86-51 Tuesday night. Thomas Young scored 16 points and Mike Housman had 14 for the Retrievers (2-2), who have won two straight. UMBC followed up a 36-point first half with a 50-point second half featuring a 67-percent shooting effort from the field. Matt Betley scored a career-high 18 points for the Leopards (1-4), who have dropped four straight. The Retrievers, who shot 58 percent from the field for the game, enjoyed their fourth-largest margin of victory in team history, the second-best against a Division I opponent. Greene had six 3-pointers and Pugh had five -- both career highs -- as UMBC shot 12-for-23 from beyond the arc. Lafayette got within 38-30 early in the second half on Betley's 3 from the right side, but UMBC used a 23-5 run to extend the lead. The Leopards failed to score from the field for 9:25 and scored only once from the floor over the final 12:24. Pugh scored 14 first-half points and the Retrievers led 36-25 at halftime. UMBC jumped to a 21-5 lead, with Pugh tallying eight points in a 13-0 run early in the game. In between two right-wing 3-pointers, Pugh scored a layup on a backdoor cut. Lafayette hit four 3-pointers to cut the lead to 26-17 with 8:02 left in the half.
